title: Mouchette
creator_credit: Argos Films, Parc Film, Anatole Dauman and Robert Bresson
brief_description: Based on the Georges Bernanos novel “Nouvelle histiore de Mouchette”, Robert Bresson’s unflinching tale of poverty and cruelty is an agonising and unsentimental film experience. Mouchette (Nadine Nortier) is a 14 year old peasant school girl. Her mother is dying and her father is a brutal alcoholic, leaving her to fend for herself and her baby brother amidst a harsh and indifferent community. When local poacher Arsene (Jean-Claude Guilbert) turns to Mouchette for an alibi over a possible murder, the young girl desperately responds to his neediness, unaware that she is being used yet again. Bresson strips scenes, performances and emotions down to their bare necessities, creating a unique style which at first might seem alienating but ultimately depicts the human experience with mystery, grace and poignancy. In French with English subtitles. Cast also includes Maria Cardinal, Paul Herbert, Jean Vimenet (Awards: Best film 1967 Venice Film festival)
